edu.smu.tspell.wordnet.impl.file
Class ReferenceSynset

java.lang.Object
  edu.smu.tspell.wordnet.impl.AbstractSynset
      edu.smu.tspell.wordnet.impl.file.ReferenceSynset
All Implemented Interfaces:
Synset
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdjectiveReferenceSynset, AdverbReferenceSynset, NounReferenceSynset, VerbReferenceSynset
public abstract class ReferenceSynset
extends AbstractSynset

A synset implementation that supports the concept of unresolved semantic and lexical relationships to other synsets. An "unresolved" relationship is one for which we have identifying information for the related synset(s) but have not yet converted that information into an actual reference to another synset object. Conversely, a "resolved" relationship is one for which the identifying information has been converted into an object reference to another synset. This approach allows us to load synset information without immediately loading / creating the synsets to which that original one has relationships defined. In other words, we can perform lazy instantiation of the related synsets only when / if a request is made to access them.

Note that the unresolved / resolved state for a given relationship is a one-way conversion. In on other words, once an unresolved relationship is converted to a resolved object reference, the original relationship information is assumed to no longer be needed and is dropped. As a result, it's not practical (and probably isn't ever necessary) to convert a resolved object reference back to an unresolved relationship.

ReferenceSynset

protected ReferenceSynset(SynsetType type,
                          String definition,
                          String[] examples,
                          SenseKey[] senseKeys,
                          RelationshipPointers pointers,
                          int lexicalFile,
                          int offset)
Constructor that accepts the basic synset properties.

Parameters:
type - Type of synset this instance represents.
definition - Short description / definition of the meaning.
examples - Examples of how the synset is used.
senseKeys - Keys of word senses associated with this synset.
pointers - Unresolved relationships.
lexicalFile - Number of the lexical file containing synset.
offset - Byte offset into the data file where synset is defined.

getTagCount

public int getTagCount(String wordForm)
                throws WordNetException
Returns a number that's intended to provide an approximation of how frequently the specified word form is used to represent this meaning relative to how often it's used to represent other meanings.

Parameters:
wordForm - Word form for which to return the tag count.
Returns:
Number that's used to indicate an approximate frequency of use.
Throws:
WordNetException - The specified word form is not part of this synset.
See Also:
Format of cntlist File.

getAntonyms

public WordSense[] getAntonyms(String wordForm)
                        throws WordNetException
Returns the antonyms (words with the opposite meaning), if any, associated with a word form in this synset.

For example, an antonym of "inhale" is "exhale".

Parameters:
wordForm - Word form for which to return antonyms.
Returns:
The antonyms of this synset.
Throws:
WordNetException - An error occurred retrieving data.

Returns word forms that derivationally related to the one specified.

For example, a derivationally related form of "meter" is "metrical".

Returns:

getSingletonSense

protected WordSense getSingletonSense(RelationshipType type,
                                      String wordForm)
                               throws WordNetException
Returns either zero or one word sense for a particular relationship type and word form. This is used when there can't be more than one relationship of a particular type for a given word form and this code validates that cardinality, throwing an exception if it is violated.

Parameters:
type - Relationship type for which to return a word sense.
wordForm - Word form for which to return the word sense.
Returns:
Word sense for the specified word form of the indicated type or null if no such relationship exists.
Throws:
WordNetException - An error occurred retrieving data.

getReferences

protected WordSense[] getReferences(RelationshipType type,
                                    String wordForm)
                             throws WordNetException
Returns the lexical relationships for a particular word form.

Note that the relationships are left as pointers until they're actually retrieved for the first time, at which point they'll be resolved.

Parameters:
type - Type of relationships to return.
wordForm - Word form for which to return lexical relationships.
Returns:
Lexical relationships of a single type for the specified word form.
Throws:
WordNetException - An error occurred retrieving data.

Parameters:
wordIndex - Index of the word form for which to return the sense key.
Returns:
Sense key associated with the word at the specified index.

getIndexEntry

protected SenseIndexEntry getIndexEntry(SenseKey senseKey)
Returns the entry from the sense index file that corresponds to a word sense in this synset.

Because we don't have the full sense key when we build the entries in this synset (we only have what's in the pos.data file for the synset), we'll need to check this synset's offset / pointer value with each one that's stored in the index entries. That's necessary because there can be multiple index entries that vary only by their head word information, and since we don't have the head word information we'll need to make sure that the index entry is associated with this synset by comparing offset values.

Parameters:
senseKey - Sense key for which to return the sense index entry.
Returns:
Index entry for this synset's word sense.
